intro: Helietta lucida, commonly known as the white beakspur, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, which helps retain moisture. Helietta lucida is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in temperate climates.
